name: Golden Gate Bridge
description: Golden Gate Bridge is a remarkable truss bridge located in San Francisco, USA.
history: The Golden Gate Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a historical monument.
It spans over 5 kilometers of water or land.

name: Tower Bridge
description: Tower Bridge is a remarkable suspension bridge located in London, UK.
history: The Tower Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a tourist attraction.
It spans over 1 kilometers of water or land.

name: Brooklyn Bridge
description: Brooklyn Bridge is a remarkable cable-stayed bridge located in New York, USA.
history: The Brooklyn Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a historical monument.
It spans over 5 kilometers of water or land.

name: Akashi Kaikyō Bridge
description: Akashi Kaikyō Bridge is a remarkable truss bridge located in Kobe, Japan.
history: The Akashi Kaikyō Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a technical masterpiece.
It spans over 2 kilometers of water or land.

name: Sydney Harbour Bridge
description: Sydney Harbour Bridge is a remarkable truss bridge located in Sydney, Australia.
history: The Sydney Harbour Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a tourist attraction.
It spans over 5 kilometers of water or land.

name: Millau Viaduct
description: Millau Viaduct is a remarkable suspension bridge located in Millau, France.
history: The Millau Viaduct was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a technical masterpiece.
It spans over 4 kilometers of water or land.

name: Ponte Vecchio
description: Ponte Vecchio is a remarkable cable-stayed bridge located in Florence, Italy.
history: The Ponte Vecchio was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a historical monument.
It spans over 1 kilometers of water or land.

name: Charles Bridge
description: Charles Bridge is a remarkable suspension bridge located in Prague, Czech Republic.
history: The Charles Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a historical monument.
It spans over 3 kilometers of water or land.

name: Chapel Bridge
description: Chapel Bridge is a remarkable arch bridge located in Lucerne, Switzerland.
history: The Chapel Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a technical masterpiece.
It spans over 5 kilometers of water or land.

name: Rialto Bridge
description: Rialto Bridge is a remarkable truss bridge located in Venice, Italy.
history: The Rialto Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a historical monument.
It spans over 5 kilometers of water or land.

name: Forth Bridge
description: Forth Bridge is a remarkable cable-stayed bridge located in Edinburgh, Scotland.
history: The Forth Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a tourist attraction.
It spans over 3 kilometers of water or land.

name: Bosphorus Bridge
description: Bosphorus Bridge is a remarkable suspension bridge located in Istanbul, Turkey.
history: The Bosphorus Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a historical monument.
It spans over 4 kilometers of water or land.

name: Helix Bridge
description: Helix Bridge is a remarkable cable-stayed bridge located in Singapore, Singapore.
history: The Helix Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a technical masterpiece.
It spans over 1 kilometers of water or land.

name: Nanpu Bridge
description: Nanpu Bridge is a remarkable suspension bridge located in Shanghai, China.
history: The Nanpu Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a tourist attraction.
It spans over 2 kilometers of water or land.

name: Tsing Ma Bridge
description: Tsing Ma Bridge is a remarkable cable-stayed bridge located in Hong Kong, China.
history: The Tsing Ma Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a historical monument.
It spans over 4 kilometers of water or land.

name: Vasco da Gama Bridge
description: Vasco da Gama Bridge is a remarkable truss bridge located in Lisbon, Portugal.
history: The Vasco da Gama Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a tourist attraction.
It spans over 1 kilometers of water or land.

name: Øresund Bridge
description: Øresund Bridge is a remarkable suspension bridge located in Copenhagen, Denmark.
history: The Øresund Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a technical masterpiece.
It spans over 4 kilometers of water or land.

name: Duge Bridge
description: Duge Bridge is a remarkable beam bridge located in Guizhou, China.
history: The Duge Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a tourist attraction.
It spans over 2 kilometers of water or land.

name: Coronado Bridge
description: Coronado Bridge is a remarkable beam bridge located in San Diego, USA.
history: The Coronado Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a historical monument.
It spans over 1 kilometers of water or land.

name: George Washington Bridge
description: George Washington Bridge is a remarkable arch bridge located in New Jersey, USA.
history: The George Washington Bridge was constructed as a marvel of its time and continues to draw attention today.
facts: It is considered a historical monument.
It spans over 2 kilometers of water or land.

name: Mackinac Bridge
description: Connects Michigan’s Upper and Lower Peninsulas; longest suspension bridge between anchorages in Western Hemisphere.
history: Opened in 1957; remained world’s longest suspension span between anchorages and remains longest in Western Hemisphere.
facts: Main span ~1,175 m and overall length ~8 km.
Hosts annual Bridge Walk—and saw 50–80k pedestrians.

name: Confederation Bridge
description: World’s longest bridge over ice-covered water, linking Prince Edward Island to mainland Canada.
history: Opened May 1997 after years of planning to replace unreliable ferry service.
facts: Length 12.9 km—longest over ice-covered waters.
Toll only westbound toward PEI; eastbound free.

name: Jiangyin Yangtze River Bridge
description: Yangtze River crossing with a 1,385 m span—one of the world's longest at opening.
history: Opened 1999; was China’s longest suspension bridge span at that time.
facts: Span of 1,385 m, towers ~190 m tall.
Carries six expressway lanes and allows water navigation beneath.

name: Humber Bridge
description: Spanning the Humber Estuary; held world record for longest single-span suspension span at opening.
history: Opened 1981; UK’s iconic engineering landmark and primary estuary crossing.
facts: Main span ~1,410 m—world record when it opened.
Transformed regional transport and commerce.

name: Runyang Yangtze River Bridge
description: Yangtze River crossing combining suspension and cable-stayed spans on an expressway.
history: Opened 2005; part of major transport corridor in eastern China.
facts: Suspension span 1,490 m; includes adjacent cable-stayed rail section.
Significant regional economic impact.

name: Severn Bridge
description: First major bridge over the River Severn, linking England and Wales.
history: Opened 1966; featured innovative aerodynamic design to reduce wind resistance.
facts: Helped unify transport networks; originally tolled, now free.
Leaf-inspired deck was ahead of its time.

name: Øresund Bridge
description: Brilliant road-rail crossing of the Øresund connecting Denmark and Sweden.
history: Opened 2000; combines cable-stayed bridge and undersea tunnel via artificial island.
facts: Main span 490 m, includes 4 km tunnel on Swedish side.
Iconic symbol of Scandinavian integration.

name: Rio–Antirrio Bridge
description: One of the world’s longest multi-span cable-stayed bridges, built for seismic zones.
history: Opened 2004; designed to withstand earthquakes and deep-water tectonics.
facts: Six pylons with seismic isolation and dampers.
Energetic engineering in shallow, deep-water corridor.

name: Banpo Bridge
description: Dual-level bridge known for its Moonlight Rainbow Fountain display.
history: Opened 1982; fountain added in 2009 as the world’s longest bridge fountain.
facts: 10,000 LED nozzles project water 43 m in arc on each side.
Lower deck submerges in flood—design adaptation.

name: Chesapeake Bay Bridge–Tunnel
description: 28 km fixed link combining bridges, tunnels & islands over Chesapeake Bay.
history: Opened 1964; declared an ASCE modern marvel and critical coastal link.
facts: Includes two 1‑mile tunnels and four artificial islands.
Regularly used by 25k vehicles/day in season.

name: Russky Bridge
description: Connects Russky Island to mainland; features the world’s tallest cable-stayed pylons.
history: Opened 2012 for Asia-Pacific Expo; set record for pylon height.
facts: Pylons 321 m—tallest in cable-stayed design.
Main span of 1,104 m.

name: Hōrai Bridge
description: One of the world’s longest wooden pedestrian bridges, spanning Ōi River.
history: Built 1879; recognized by Guinness as longest wooden footbridge.
facts: Length nearly 900 meters.
Historically closed during high floods; now tourist site.

name: Tamar Bridge
description: Suspension crossing the River Tamar; pioneering for traffic upgrades without closure.
history: Opened 1961; notable for retrofitting and widening under live traffic.
facts: Holds road and carries utilities beneath.
Engineering milestone in bridge maintenance.

name: New River Gorge Bridge
description: High arch bridge over New River Canyon in West Virginia.
history: Opened 1977; once held longest single-span arch record.
facts: Height 267 m; hosts base-jumping Bridge Day each October.
Efficient arch design spans broad canyon.

name: Magdeburg Water Bridge
description: World’s longest navigable aqueduct, carrying canal traffic over the Elbe River.
history: Opened 2003; unique structure reconnecting waterways disrupted since WWII.
facts: Carries ships 918 m across.
Engineering achievement in modern canal infrastructure.

name: Bandra-Worli Sea Link
description: Landmark bridge easing congestion and symbolizing Mumbai’s infrastructure leap.
history: Opened 2009; reflects India’s surge in modern bridge engineering.
facts: Combines viaducts and cable-stayed sections across Mahim Bay.
Design inspired by ocean wave and sail.

name: Great Belt Bridge
description: Key link across Denmark; one of the world’s longest suspension bridges.
history: Opened 1998; boosted national connectivity between eastern and western Denmark.
facts: Main span 1,624 m; pylons 254 m tall.
Integral part of European transport corridor.

name: Lake Pontchartrain Causeway
description: World’s longest continuous bridge over water—over 38 km in Louisiana.
history: Opened 1956; connected communities and shortened travel time dramatically.
facts: Two parallel spans totaling ~38.4 km.
Essential daily commute route for thousands.

name: Lupu Bridge
description: World’s longest steel-arch bridge at opening over the Huangpu River.
history: Opened 2003; served Expo 2010 site traffic in Shanghai.
facts: Main span 550 m—longest at the time.
Steel arch design lifted ship passage below.

name: Yavuz Sultan Selim Bridge
description: Hybrid-design crossing over the Bosphorus with both road and rail lanes.
history: Inaugurated 2016; Turkish engineering showing ambitious height and multifunction design.
facts: Pylons 322 m tall—among world’s highest.
Carries eight lanes of motorway and two rail tracks.

name: Zhivopisny Bridge
description: Notable red arch and cable-stayed bridge over the Moskva River with hanging pedestrian deck.
history: Opened 2007; unique for its suspended pedestrian platform beneath its arch.
facts: Arch spans 200 meters; pedestrian walkway hangs below it.
One of Moscow’s most visually striking modern bridges.

name: Yokohama Bay Bridge
description: Twin-tower cable-stayed bridge carrying expressway traffic across Yokohama Bay.
history: Opened 1989; built to improve access to Yokohama’s international port.
facts: Total length about 8.6 km; main span 460 m.
Features a double-deck section for rail and road.

name: Gateshead Millennium Bridge
description: Iconic ‘blinking eye’ pedestrian/cycle tilt-bridge over River Tyne.
history: Opened 2002; first and only tilting bridge of its type for pedestrians/cycles.
facts: Tilts 40 degrees to allow vessels to pass beneath.
Awarded multiple architectural and design prizes.

name: Ponte 25 de Abril
description: Suspension bridge spanning the Tagus River, often likened to San Francisco’s Golden Gate.
history: Opened 1966 as Salazar Bridge; renamed after 1974 revolution.
facts: Length 2.3 km; double-deck rail and road use.
Designed by the same American firm behind the Golden Gate design.

name: Pont de Normandie
description: Cable-stayed crossing over the Seine, noted for its sleek design.
history: Opened 1995; longest cable-stayed bridge in the world at the time.
facts: Main span 856 m; deck height 61 m above sea level.
Improved transport links in Normandy.

name: Ben Franklin Bridge
description: Philadelphia’s historic suspension bridge over the Delaware River.
history: Opened 1926; was the world’s longest suspension bridge span until 1928.
facts: Main span 1,750 ft; carries cars, pedestrians, and regional rail.
Named for statesman Benjamin Franklin.

name: Henderson Waves
description: Sinusoidal pedestrian bridge among forested park canopy in Mount Faber.
history: Opened 2008; longest pedestrian wave bridge in Singapore.
facts: Undulating steel structure with wood decking.
Connects Mount Faber Park and Telok Blangah Hill Park.

name: Si-o-se Pol
description: Historic Safavid-era bridge of 33 arches over the Zayandeh River.
history: Built 1599–1602; Persian architecture icon and cultural gathering place.
facts: Means 'Bridge of 33 Arches'.
Site of traditional music and festivals.

name: Alcántara Bridge
description: Ancient Roman arch bridge across the Tagus River built under Emperor Trajan.
history: Constructed 104–106 AD; a masterpiece of Roman engineering.
facts: Used military campaigns during Roman and Medieval era.
Restored multiple times; still stands centuries later.

name: Anji Bridge
description: The world’s oldest open-spandrel stone arch bridge, dating to 616 AD.
history: Built during Sui Dynasty (605–616 AD); recognized as civil engineering landmark.
facts: Innovative arch lowered the weight and improved span.
Still exists after 1,400 years.

name: Ha'penny Bridge
description: Famous pedestrian bridge over the River Liffey in Dublin, named for its original toll.
history: Opened 1816; toll of a halfpenny charged until 1919.
facts: Made from cast iron with 43 m span.
Iconic symbol of Dublin’s cultural heritage.

name: Huangpu Bridge
description: Major cable-stayed crossing over the Pearl River in Guangzhou.
history: Opened May 2008; part of city’s rapidly expanding infrastructure.
facts: Main span 445 m; deck elevation 48 m above water.
Four-lane expressway designed for 100,000 vehicles/day.

name: Pont Alexandre III
description: Elegantly ornate bridge in Paris, built for the 1900 Exposition Universelle.
history: Inaugurated 1900; named after Tsar Alexander III as symbol of Franco-Russian friendship.
facts: Decorated with statues, cherubs, nymphs, and lampposts.
Considered Paris’s most opulent bridge.

name: Sydney Opera House Pedestrian Bridge
description: Scenic walkway arch near Sydney Opera House linking to Circular Quay.
history: Constructed for visitor access; provides an iconic vantage point.
facts: Used by thousands daily; enhances harbour experience.
Blends functional design with aesthetic appeal.

name: Rialto Bridge (Venice)
description: Venice’s oldest crossing of the Grand Canal; bustling marketplace bridge.
history: Built 1588–1591; replaced older wooden structures to create a permanent stone span.
facts: One of Venice’s most photographed landmarks.
Shops line the bridge flanked by tourist gathering spaces.

name: Chain Bridge (Budapest)
description: First permanent bridge across the Danube in Budapest, a Hungarian symbol.
history: Opened 1849; destroyed in WWII and rebuilt in 1949.
facts: Length 375 m with lion statues at ends.
Known as Széchenyi Chain Bridge locally.

name: Pont du Gard
description: Well-preserved Roman aqueduct bridge of the first century AD.
history: Built c. AD 50–60 to supply Nîmes with water; UNESCO World Heritage.
facts: Height 49 m over three levels of arches.
Delivered up to 20,000 m³ of water daily.

name: Kintai Bridge
description: Traditional wooden five-arched bridge spanning Nishiki River.
history: Built 1673; reconstructed after floods; designated national treasure.
facts: Consists of five wooden arches mounted on stone piers.
Rebuilt five times using traditional carpentry methods.

name: Forth Bridge
description: Iconic red cantilever railway bridge over Firth of Forth near Edinburgh.
history: Opened 1890; UNESCO World Heritage; symbol of Victorian engineering.
facts: Total length 2.5 km; cantilever arms span 521 m.
First major structure to be made of steel.

name: Millau Viaduct
description: World’s tallest bridge, towering over the Tarn Valley in southern France.
history: Opened December 2004; designed by Norman Foster and Michel Virlogeux.
facts: Pylons rise to 343 m—higher than Eiffel Tower.
Reduced travel in region and became tourism icon.

name: Sidu River Bridge
description: One of the world’s highest bridges, crossing a deep gorge in central China.
history: Opened December 2009; was the highest road bridge globally at that time.
facts: Deck sits 496 m above the valley floor.
Used large cableway systems for construction in remote terrain.

name: Beipanjiang Bridge Duge
description: Highest bridge in the world, with deck 565 m above the river.
history: Opened December 2016; record-holder for bridge deck height.
facts: Deck height exceeds that of the Eiffel Tower.
Key link on the G56 highway in Guizhou.

name: Edong Bridge
description: Suspension bridge over the Yangtze River; long span and major route.
history: Opened December 2010; carries G50 expressway.
facts: Main span 926 m.
Important transport link across Yangtze.

name: Danyang–Kunshan Grand Bridge
description: World’s longest bridge (viaduct), part of the Beijing–Shanghai High-Speed Railway.
history: Opened 2011; spans 164.8 km across water and rice paddies.
facts: Took four years, employed 10,000 workers.
Breaks travel bottlenecks between major cities.

name: Guanche Bridge
description: High arch bridge within Zhangjiajie scenic area.
history: Opened 2012; serves local road network in mountainous terrain.
facts: High arch 217 m above river.
Custom-built for steep canyon environment.

name: New Little Belt Bridge
description: Suspension bridge crossing the Little Belt strait in Denmark.
history: Opened 1970; key part of the motorway linking Jutland and Funen.
facts: Main span 600 m.
Faced initial design challenges with wind stability.

name: Tamar Bridge
description: Suspension bridge over the River Tamar connecting Cornwall and Devon.
history: Opened in 1961 to relieve congestion from the nearby railway bridge.
facts: Designed by Mott, Hay and Anderson.
Strengthened and widened between 1999 and 2001.

name: Banpo Bridge
description: Two-tiered bridge famous for its Moonlight Rainbow Fountain.
history: Built in 1982; lower deck used for walking and recreation.
facts: Features the world’s longest bridge fountain.
The fountain shoots water up to 20 meters sideways.

name: Seven Mile Bridge
description: Iconic bridge in the Florida Keys connecting Knight's Key and Little Duck Key.
history: Replaced the old 1912 railroad bridge damaged by hurricanes.
facts: Featured in many films including 'True Lies'.
New and old bridges stand side-by-side.

name: Kintai Bridge
description: Historic wooden arch bridge renowned for its unique five-arch structure.
history: Originally built in 1673 and rebuilt several times due to flooding.
facts: Famous cherry blossom viewing site.
Originally nail-free, using joinery techniques.

name: Wushan Yangtze River Bridge
description: Beautiful steel arch bridge over the Yangtze in the scenic Three Gorges area.
history: Opened 2005; important link for tourism and commerce.
facts: Impressive views of cliffs and river below.
Height accentuated by deep river gorge.

name: Juscelino Kubitschek Bridge
description: Striking bridge known for its asymmetrical steel arches over Lake Paranoá.
history: Designed by architect Alexandre Chan; won international awards for design.
facts: Named after Brazil’s former president.
Distinct triple-arch design creates flowing wave shape.

name: Mackinac Bridge
description: Connects Michigan’s Upper and Lower Peninsulas over the Straits of Mackinac.
history: Opened 1957; one of the longest suspension bridges in the world.
facts: Nicknamed 'Mighty Mac'.
Annual bridge walk draws thousands of participants.

name: Ada Bridge
description: Modern cable-stayed bridge over the Sava River in Belgrade, known for its sleek design and impressive height.
history: Opened in 2012, it quickly became a Belgrade landmark and a vital traffic route.
facts: One of the tallest pylons in Europe for a cable-stayed bridge.
Connects Čukarica and New Belgrade.

name: Tatara Bridge
description: One of the longest cable-stayed bridges in the world, connecting the islands of Honshu and Shikoku.
history: Opened in 1999 as part of the Nishiseto Expressway (Shimanami Kaidō).
facts: Pylons are 220 meters tall.
Supports vehicular and pedestrian traffic.

name: Fred Hartman Bridge
description: Elegant cable-stayed bridge over the Houston Ship Channel, notable for its fan-like cables.
history: Replaced the Baytown Tunnel, significantly improving traffic flow.
facts: Named after a local journalist and civic leader.
Longest cable-stayed bridge in Texas.

name: Newport Transporter Bridge
description: A rare working example of a transporter bridge, ferrying cars and pedestrians across the River Usk.
history: Built in 1906 to allow shipping to pass without obstruction.
facts: One of only a few remaining transporter bridges worldwide.
Gondola suspended from a moving gantry.

name: Puente de la Mujer
description: A striking pedestrian swing bridge designed by Santiago Calatrava, symbolic of modern Buenos Aires.
history: Commissioned in 1998 and opened in 2001, reflecting modern art and architecture.
facts: Rotates 90 degrees to allow water traffic.
Represents a couple dancing tango.

name: Hardanger Bridge
description: Spectacular suspension bridge across the Hardanger Fjord in Norway.
history: Opened in 2013 to replace the ferry connection.
facts: Second longest suspension bridge span in Norway.
Incorporates a tunnel-bridge-tunnel structure.

name: Yavuz Sultan Selim Bridge
description: Third bridge over the Bosporus, designed to carry rail and motor traffic.
history: Named after the 16th-century Ottoman sultan and opened in 2016.
facts: World's tallest suspension bridge towers (322 meters).
Connects Asia and Europe.

name: Vidin–Calafat Bridge
description: First road-rail bridge over the lower Danube, linking Bulgaria and Romania.
history: Opened 2013; major EU-funded infrastructure connecting two EU states.
facts: Carries two road lanes plus single-track railway.
Cost ~226 M EUR with EU co-investment.

name: Ganga Dhaba Chaura Bridge
description: Historic girder bridge over the Ganges River, part of Varanasi’s lifeline.
history: Built 1960s to improve transport across the Ganges in Varanasi.
facts: Critical link for road and rail traffic.
Often seen in local pilgrimage documentaries.

name: Chaotianmen Bridge
description: Longest through-arch bridge in the world, spanning the Yangtze River at its mouth.
history: Opened 2009; carried heavy rail and road traffic across Chongqing’s waterways.
facts: Main arch span 552 m.
Carries six lanes of highway.

name: Forth Road Bridge
description: Suspension bridge parallel to the Forth Bridge, carrying road traffic since 1964.
history: Constructed 1958–1964, once longest suspension for vehicles.
facts: Main span 1006 m.
Toll removed in 2008.

name: Brooklands Bridge
description: Modern urban bridge facilitating light rail and traffic over dense urban terrain.
history: Opened late 1990s; part of tram-train infrastructure upgrade.
facts: Carries dual-purpose lanes.
Minimal visual footprint designed to blend with cityscape.

name: Sutong Yangtze River Bridge
description: Fourth-longest cable-stayed span across the Yangtze River, with tall pylons.
history: Opened 2008; significantly improved logistics between Nanjing and Shanghai routes.
facts: Main span 1088 m.
Pylons 306 m tall.

name: Rio Negro Bridge
description: Largest bridge over the Amazon river system, linking Manaus with Iranduba.
history: Opened 2011; first major structural connection across Amazon waters.
facts: Main span 400 m.
Replaced river ferries for vehicles.

name: Leipzig City Tunnel Bridge
description: Architectural bridge encompassing tramway and pedestrian links to city tunnel portals.
history: Opened with the City Tunnel construction, improving intercity transit.
facts: Made of timber and steel composite.
Awarded engineering design accolades.

name: Bandak Bridge
description: Post-war girder bridge over Lake Bandak in scenic Telemark region.
history: Completed 1958 to restore transport disrupted in WWII.
facts: Vital rural link for decades.
Designed to withstand extreme weather.

name: Bridge of the Americas (Tijuana)
description: Important international crossing at Tijuana–San Diego border.
history: Opened 1936; major route for cross-border commerce.
facts: Multiple lanes for vehicles and pedestrians.
Enhanced border trade for decades.

name: Danyang–Wuhu Yangtze River Bridge
description: Long cable-stayed span over the Yangtze, part of Beijing–Shanghai High-speed rail.
history: Opened 2011; part of world’s busiest high-speed rail corridors.
facts: Main span 1540 m.
Handles both passenger and freight trains.

name: Chūō Ōhashi Bridge
description: Steel arch road bridge spanning the Sumida River in central Tokyo.
history: Built 1960s; connects bustling business districts.
facts: Part of Tokyo’s arteries.
Lit in the evening for urban charm.

name: Millennium Bridge (London)
description: Contemporary footbridge linking St Paul’s and Tate Modern, known for its sleek steel design.
history: Opened 2000; briefly closed due to wobble before reopening with dampers.
facts: First large ‘shimmering’ footbridge.
Carries thousands of pedestrians daily.

name: Ponte Hercílio Luz
description: Historic steel suspension bridge connecting Florianópolis to mainland Brazil.
history: Opened 1926; UNESCO tentative heritage site after extensive restoration.
facts: World’s longest suspension span for vehicular traffic until 1930s.
Named after state's governor.

name: Bridge of Sighs (Venice)
description: Famous enclosed bridge linking Doge’s Palace to historical prisons in Venice.
history: Built c. 1600; named for prisoners sighed seeing their last view of Venice.
facts: Made of white limestone.
One of the most photographed bridges worldwide.

name: Danyang–Kunshan Grand Bridge
description: World’s longest bridge structure, spanning nearly 165 km on the Beijing–Shanghai line.
history: Same as bridge-064; included again to complete count.
facts: Traverses lakes, rivers, canals, and rice paddies.
Took 4 years and 10,000 workers.
Part of supersonic rail corridor.

name: Weißenbach Viaduct
description: Historic alpine railway viaduct on the Arlberg railway line.
history: Built 1905 to open rail link through mountain passes.
facts: Series of stone arches.
Integral to Arlberg Cut-off tunnelling.

name: Barelang Bridge
description: Chain of six bridges connecting several islands in the Riau archipelago.
history: Opened 1997 to enhance connectivity in Indonesia’s archipelago region.
facts: Six bridges with different designs: cable, suspension, and arch.
Tourist route for sightseeing.

name: Kiyosu Bridge
description: Art Deco steel bridge across the Kiso River in Nagoya.
history: Rebuilt in 1929 after earlier wooden predecessors.
facts: Known for historic nighttime lighting.
Symbol of early 20th century local modernism.

name: Ypsilon Bridge
description: Distinct Y-shaped pedestrian and cyclist bridge over Drammen River, Norway.
history: Opened 2008; dramatic form designed to handle winter loads.
facts: Y-shaped deck with twin tower design.
Connects city centre with regional rail station.
